intro: Achillea taygetea, commonly known as the Greek yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, gray-green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats. Achillea taygetea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
